Text.Value: You can trust me to use the stones as we planned - to defeat the brain, and nothing more. It's the perfect solution.
I won't have to look at you much longer anyway, so I'm really getting the good end of the deal.

EditorData.NodeContext: Cheekily. Saying she's dying soon so she won't have to see the player be an ugly mind flayer for long. Macabre humor, but she means it affectionately.

Text.Value: Say you agree. Please.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Node subject: Direct focus to player. What do you think we should do?

Text.Value: I trust you. Do what you think is right, and I'll stand by you.
Are you sure this is what you want?
The Emperor might be right, but we're not out of options yet.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Node subject: We have an option: Me

Text.Value: Soldier, my heart feels like a live grenade - gonna blow any minute. You still have a life to live. I don't.
Let me do this for you. For me. Please, darling. I want to.

EditorData.NodeContext: Her resolve cracks slightly on the 'darling,' an aside to the player if they're in love.

Text.Value: This should be my sacrifice to make. Not yours.
Thank you, darling.

EditorData.NodeContext: Her resolve cracks slightly on the 'darling,' an aside to the player if they're in love.

Text.Value: No - none of us is turning into a mind flayer. If that means giving them the stones, then so be it.
If this is the end for you, you should go out as yourself, not a mind flayer.
I'd rather be a mind flayer than have to watch you become one. You still get to live. Do it as you.
I can't, Karlach. I'm sorry. I want it to be me, not you.
I've never been more sure of anything. This heart inside me is about to blow. Doesn't matter which body it takes out with it, right?
If anyone was gonna look even better with tentacles, it was gonna be me. Let's do this.
We should at least free Orpheus first. There might be another solution here.
If this is the end for me, let me be the motherfucker who saved the world.
All right. If this is what you really want, all I can say is thank you.
You're very fucking welcome, soldier.

EditorData.NodeContext: Full of Bond-like charm. She's just agreed to take on the ultimate sacrifice, and she's doing it with style.

Text.Value: Leave
But if you change your mind, just say so. I'm here. And I'm ready for whatever comes next.
I know you. I know you know your own mind. If this is what you want, then all I can say is give 'em Hell, soldier.
Let me transform. I'm... I'm not long for this world. I can feel it.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Node subject: Re-establish the Karlach option
EditorData.NodeContext: The weight behind this is Karlach knows she's gonna die, and that's why she's offering.

Synopsis: The Emperor has just provided the avatar the option to transform into a mind flayer in order to use the Netherstones to defeat the Netherbrain. Karlach is dying, so knowing this she offers the player to take their place as a mind flayer.
